commitMessage:
fix: complete removal of all interactive prompts from ship command (HODGE-282)

## What Changed
- Removed 40+ lines of interactive prompt code from ship.ts (lines 439-471)
- Removed protected branch confirmation prompts (lines 714-747)
- Enhanced slash command state detection in claude-commands.ts
- Added comprehensive test coverage with 2 new test files
- Updated ship.md documentation for non-interactive workflow
- Modified interaction state manager for smart state detection

## Why This Change
The ship command was still attempting interactive prompts when called
from slash commands, violating the core architecture standard that all
CLI commands must be non-interactive. This caused failures when the
slash command tried to execute ship with no ability for user interaction.

## Impact
- Ship command now properly detects pre-approved messages from state.json
- Slash commands can fully control the ship workflow without CLI prompts
- Protected branch handling deferred to slash command layer
- Improved reliability for automated workflows and CI/CD pipelines
- Zero interactive prompts ensures consistent behavior

## Technical Details
- State detection checks for "edited" status in interaction state
- Falls back to default messages in non-interactive environments
- Clean separation between slash command UI and CLI execution

Closes HODGE-282
